title: What to do after dark this half-term: 30 illuminating ideas, from mammal tracking to neon painting
text:
Put down your cup of cocoa. Step out of your slippers. It might be dark outside, but it’s only 6pm and there are hours until bedtime. It’s time to get outdoors and explore winter, not hide away from it.

Hygge, coorie, even kalsarikänni (the Finnish word for sitting indoors in your pants, drinking beer) have popularised the notion that the best response to the long dark winter months is to go into hibernation. It might work for bears and bats, but it’s not the solution for humans.
